Cette série incontournable, aux dialogues hilarants, parodie à merveille les petits travers du couple au quotidien. Retrouvez Chouchou et Loulou dans leurs aventures irrésistibles !

programme.title: Cauchemar à l'hôtel
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay tente de sauver le Juniper Hill, une demeure historique située dans un village pittoresque du Vermont. Cette luxueuse résidence de 28 chambres est à la dérive. Les propriétaires ont dépensé une fortune pour en faire un musée d'art. Robert Dean II et son compagnon, Ari Nikki, mènent la vie de château, snobent la population locale et traitent les employés avec un royal mépris. Le manque de communication est criant et le personnel est toujours payé en retard. Sans l'aide de Gordon, le Juniper Hill est condamné...

programme.title: Cauchemar à l'hôtel
programme.desc: Le séjour de Gordon au Juniper Hill est une catastrophe... La gestion de l'établissement est désastreuse. Ancien antiquaire, Dean n'a aucune expérience dans l'hôtellerie et les prix sont trop élevés pour les gens de la région. Les propriétaires utilisent les lieux pour recevoir leurs amis en grande pompe. Gordon est sur le point d'abandonner mais il décide finalement de se battre pour le personnel. Il commence par engager une équipe de déménageurs pour se débarrasser des meubles et objets superflus. Gordon aura-t-il suffisamment de patience ?

programme.title: Cauchemar à l'hôtel
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay tente de redonner vie au Cambridge, un hôtel de 16 chambres situé à quelques heures de Manhattan. Le propriétaire, John Imhof, est un ancien militaire qui se comporte en véritable dictateur. Mais il n'a aucune expérience et les prestations de son établissement laissent à désirer. Le Cambridge perd des milliers de dollars chaque mois. John est prêt à investir tout son argent dans l'hôtel mais sa femme Tina refuse de continuer. Gordon est-il capable de sauver un hôtel en crise et un ménage au bord du gouffre ?

programme.desc: Ils reviennent... programme.title: Talent tout neuf
programme.desc: Talent tout neuf vous fait connaître des artistes émergents de la scène pop rock française.

programme.title: Flic ou voyou
programme.desc: Le commissaire Borowitz, super flic de la police parisienne, est envoyé à Nice pour s'infiltrer dans le milieu de la pègre locale et anéantir deux bandes rivales en les montant l'une contre l'autre. Il aura fort à faire, d'autant qu'il doit aussi endiguer les élans amoureux d'une romancière, surveiller sa fille Charlotte et éviter les pièges d'inspecteurs ripoux...

programme.title: La carapate
programme.desc: Lyon Mai 68. Le détenu Martial Gaulard, innocent du meurtre dont il est accusé s'évade de prison et compromet son avocat Jean-Philippe Duroc. Tous deux se retrouvent embarqués dans une folle aventure. Duroc trouve finalement le moyen d'innocenter son client grâce à sa rencontre fortuite avec le Général de Gaulle dans les toilettes d'un héliport...

programme.title: Changeling
programme.desc: (2008, Police/Crime Drama) A single mother in 1920s Los Angeles is distraught when her son goes missing. After months of searching, the police claim to have found him, but she insists the boy is an imposter. She resolves to prove the police are trying to bury the case, but they respond by slandering her as a hysterical and unfit mother, leading to her confinement in a mental hospital. Clint Eastwood's fact-based drama, with Angelina Jolie and John Malkovich. Includes RTÉ News, Weather and iwitness

programme.title: Changeling
programme.desc: (2008, Police/Crime Drama) A single mother in 1920s Los Angeles is distraught when her son goes missing. After months of searching, the police claim to have found him, but she insists the boy is an imposter. She resolves to prove the police are trying to bury the case, but they respond by slandering her as a hysterical and unfit mother, leading to her confinement in a mental hospital. Clint Eastwood's fact-based drama, with Angelina Jolie and John Malkovich. Includes RTÉ News, Weather and iwitness

programme.title: Rush
programme.desc: Lawson and the team go on the trail of the Cuckoo, a Russian fugitive planning to unleash terrorist-like chaos across the Melbourne cityscape. Also, things get romantic for Shannon and Lawson. Australian police drama, following the lives and work of members of Melbourne's Tactical Response Unit

programme.title: BlueHeelers
programme.desc: Strange things begin to happen in the Eventide Retirement Home. Valuables go missing, one resident is found dead under mysterious circumstances and another endangers the lives of the others when he experiences a drug-induced hallucination. Australian police drama, starring William McInnes

programme.title: AmazingGrace
programme.desc: (2006, Biopic) Biopic of 18th-century abolitionist William Wilberforce. After his election to the House of Commons, the Hull-born reformer and his fellow campaigners put forward a courageous plan to introduce a bill outlawing the lucrative slave trade, but their bold initiative is met with strident opposition. Starring Ioan Gruffudd, Romola Garai, Benedict Cumberbatch, Albert Finney and Michael Gambon. Includes RTÉ News and Weather

programme.title: Fawlty Towers
programme.desc: Manuel's pet rat escapes just as a health inspector is about to pay a fact-finding visit, sending Basil on a mad dash to track it down before disaster ensues. Madcap comedy, starring John Cleese, Prunella Scales and Andrew Sachs

programme.title: RTÉ News: Six One and Weather
programme.desc: The latest national and international headlines

programme.title: Ireland's Fittest Family
programme.desc: The second set of the remaining six families go head to head in Killruddery, Co Wicklow, with the weakest group being eliminated. Olympic boxing champion Kenneth Egan, international rugby union coach Eddie O'Sullivan, Irish hockey star Nikki Symmons and Clare hurling manager Davy Fitzgerald mentor

programme.title: For One Night Only - The Dubliners
programme.desc: In a programme from 2011, the folk band join Gay Byrne to celebrate their 50th anniversary, performing their greatest hits with the help of guests Declan O'Rourke, Sharon Shannon, Shane MacGowan, Mary Coughlan and Liam O'Maonlai. The group also reflect on their achievements and pay tribute to those who have played a part in the act's career, including musicians Luke Kelly and Ronnie Drew

programme.title: Changeling
programme.desc: (2008, Police/Crime Drama) A single mother in 1920s Los Angeles is distraught when her son goes missing. After months of searching, the police claim to have found him, but she insists the boy is an imposter. She resolves to prove the police are trying to bury the case, but they respond by slandering her as a hysterical and unfit mother, leading to her confinement in a mental hospital. Clint Eastwood's fact-based drama, with Angelina Jolie and John Malkovich. Includes RTÉ News, Weather and iwitness

programme.title: Changeling

His first trip of blazing sunshine makes for a pleasant jaunt, but poor fishing prospects, and a brewing storm complicate the second

Meanwhile, Elliot tries to keep a controversial patient's case under wraps, and Jac's chances of securing the consultant's job look slim after a death in theatre

programme.desc: A robbery at an off-licence ends in violence when shop owner Danny is stabbed - and when one of the gang arrives at the hospital nursing an injured hand, it soon turns out the two know more about each other than they're letting on. A confused old man brings his dog in for treatment, so the medics humour him while they try to work out what - if anything - is wrong with the gentleman, while student nurses Robyn, Aoife and Jamie are interviewed for the two permanent staff positions in the ED. Richard Blackwood guest stars in the medical drama

programme.title: Ear to the Ground
programme.desc: Ella McSweeney reports from Longford, where she explores how animals are being given the same antibiotics as humans, causing them to enter the food chain. This overuse has led to the emergence of 'superbugs' that are resistant to the drugs. Ella asks what can be done to prevent a future crisis. Helen Carroll travels to Co Offaly where there is a resurgence in tug of war, which was once a hugely popular sport among the rural community, and is now being taken up by women. Plus, Darragh McCullough questions whether Ireland should continue to support the beef industry following cuts to EU subsidies

programme.desc: It seems that everyone in the Brown family has a date for Valentine's Day except Agnes, so she turns to the internet to find herself a man. programme.title: Live Six Nations Rugby Union
programme.desc: Ireland v Wales (Kick-off 2.30pm) and Scotland v England (Kick-off 5.00pm). Tom McGurk is joined by George Hook, Conor O'Shea and Shane Horgan to present coverage of the double bill of matches at the Aviva Stadium and Murrayfield. Much of the focus ahead of the first encounter has been on the expected hostile reception for Wales coach Warren Gatland after he dropped Irish hero Brian O'Driscoll for the third Test of last summer's Lions' tour of Australia, but matters on the pitch between these two are usually thrilling enough to relegate such events to the sidelines, and both sides will be looking to build on their opening weekend victories over Scotland and Italy respectively. With commentary by Ryle Nugent and Donal Lenihan, and pitchside reports from Brent Pope. The second of this afternoon's matches sees the teams also play for the Calcutta Cup in the oldest of all international fixtures and one in which England have an excellent recent record, with the Scots' last victory coming in 2008. Commentary by George Hamilton and Ralph Keyes

programme.title: RV:RunawayVacation
programme.desc: (2006, Comedy) An executive is forced to cancel his annual family holiday in Hawaii after he is asked to attend an important meeting in Colorado. Aiming to keep both his boss and his loved ones happy, he organises a road trip across the country - but the wheels soon come off his best-laid plans as the journey hits a series of disasters. Comedy, starring Robin Williams, Cheryl Hines, Jeff Daniels and Will Arnett

programme.title: Don't Tell the Bride
programme.desc: Groom-to-be Stephen Carroll is given the task of planning a fairytale proposal and wedding in just three weeks. Despite discussing marriage with his partner of four years Elaine Tierney, they haven't got engaged, leaving himself with extra work to do before their nuptials. Their opinions on spirituality differ and she is worried their big day will be too traditional for her tastes, but laid-back Stephen attempts to give her the mystical wedding of her dreams

programme.title: Next Week's News
programme.desc: Bernard O'Shea hosts the comedy panel show, inviting team captains PJ Gallagher and Neil Delamere and their guests to consider who and what might be hitting the headlines next week

programme.title: Vikings
programme.desc: Historical drama following the journey of Ragnar Lothbrok, the first Viking to emerge from Norse legend and on to the pages of history. The warrior and farmer dreams of finding riches by bucking the tradition of raiding to the east, and has been working on a secret project that will turn the Viking world on its head - but must first convince the powerful Earl Haraldson to share in the renown that it could bring. Starring Gabriel Byrne and Travis Fimmel

programme.title: Vikings
programme.desc: Ragnar Lothbrok gathers a crew willing to risk their lives by embarking on their first journey west, and a trip into the unknown. Earl Haraldson's paranoia reaches new heights as it becomes apparent that trust is hard to come by in this dark area. Starring Travis Fimmel and Gabriel Byrne

programme.title: Maverick
programme.desc: (1994, Comedy) Wisecracking gambler Bret Maverick and con artist Annabelle Bransford cheat their way across the Wild West to make the money they need to enter a high-stakes, once-in-a-century poker tournament, with a ruthless rival on their trail and a principled lawman as an unlikely travelling companion. Comedy Western, starring Mel Gibson and Jodie Foster, with James Garner, star of the original TV series, alongside Graham Greene and James Coburn

programme.title: Grounded for Life
programme.desc: Claudia feels unattractive being pregnant, but is cheered up by a flirtation with a cute fellow student. Meanwhile, Lily helps Eddie write material for his stand-up comedy act. Starring Lynsey Bartilson and Jake Burbage

programme.desc: Jane and Grayson defend a pageant contestant who is stripped of her crown after claiming the Miss Universal Globe competition is rigged, and Kim represents her father when he loses his coaching job. Starring Brooke Elliott and Jackson Hurst

programme.title: Live Six Nations Rugby Union
programme.desc: France v Italy (Kick-off 3.00pm). Tom McGurk is joined by George Hook and Brent Pope to present coverage of the concluding match in the second round of fixtures, which takes place at the Stade de France. The hosts are in the middle of a major rebuilding process following a diabolical series of results in 2013, which included finishing bottom of the Six Nations table, with the Italians one point and two places above them. However, they got off to a winning start at home to England this time around and have never lost at home to Italy, who were beaten away to Wales in their opener. Commentary by Hugh Cahill and Bernard Jackman

programme.title: Junior
programme.desc: (1994, Comedy) A fertility expert pioneers a treatment enabling men to become pregnant and carry babies to full term. When the authorities cancel funding for the research, he decides to test it on himself, but gives little thought to how difficult it will be to keep it a secret. The situation is further complicated when he starts to fall for the woman whose child he is carrying. Comedy, with Arnold Schwarzenegger, Danny DeVito, Emma Thompson and Frank Langella

programme.title: LeagueSunday
programme.desc: Highlights and analysis from the weekend's National Football League matches

programme.title: Attenborough: 60 Years in the Wild
programme.desc: New series. David Attenborough reflects on his TV career, charting changes in the natural world and mankind's understanding of the planet as well as developments in wildlife film-making. In the first episode, he looks back on the animal encounters that have shaped his career - from the early black-and-white Zoo Quest days to a close encounter with a lion pride in the pitch dark. He also shares a few tricks of the trade, such as how to catch a Komodo dragon and the secret to maintaining continuity in the most difficult circumstances, and recalls the making of landmark series Life on Earth

programme.title: Vikings
programme.desc: Ragnar and his crew raid a monastery on the holy island of Lindisfarne, taking everything from treasure to monks who can be sold as slaves. Earl Haraldson is unable to ignore the riches gained from this sortie and is left with no choice but to agree to let the warriors undertake a second trip out. Drama, starring Gabriel Byrne

programme.title: TheKiteRunner
programme.desc: (2007, General Movie/Drama) The friendship between two boys growing up in Afghanistan - wealthy Amir and Hassan, the son of a servant - is shattered, seemingly for ever, when Amir fails to protect Hassan from a brutal attack and later drives him away to conceal his shame. After years living in exile as a writer in America, an adult Amir returns to his home country to atone for his childhood sins by finding his friend's missing son. Drama, starring Khalid Abdalla and Atossa Leoni

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: Graham meets Matthew McConaughey, talking about his Golden Globe-winning performance in Dallas Buyers Club, Julianne Moore, starring in the action movie Non-Stop, comedian, actor and QI panellist Alan Davies, and singer-songwriter Sheryl Crow. Plus, more audience members will take their chance in the dreaded red chair

programme.title: MrNiceGuy
programme.desc: (1997, Comedy) A journalist flees for her life after filming evidence that could bring down a crime syndicate, only for the tape to accidentally fall into the hands of a TV chef. The hapless cook puts his talent for martial arts to use in battling the gangsters, who will stop at nothing to recover the incriminating video. Comedy adventure, starring Jackie Chan, Richard Norton and Miki Lee

programme.title: The Cube
programme.desc: Liverpudlian June is confident she can do well in the contest, having practised at home with her sister, while IT project manager Chris, from Edinburgh, aims to win enough money to put down a deposit on a house. Phillip Schofield provides support as they tackle a range of challenges, from agility tests to skill trials, under pressure to hold their nerve as friends, family and the studio audience watch their every move

programme.title: The Holiday Show
programme.desc: Ciara Whelan and Jon Slattery look at the best family holidays. They explore a water park in Dubai, and watch dolphins in Portugal's Algarve region. Plus, they visit the Canary island of Lanzarote, and an all-inclusive break in Turkey

programme.title: AreWeThereYet?
programme.desc: (2005, Comedy) A playboy in a fledgling romance with a single mother agrees to drive her children 350 miles to see her on New Year's Eve. Unfortunately, the youngsters have never liked any of the men she has dated, and try to ensure the road trip turns into a nightmare. Family comedy, starring Ice Cube, Jay Mohr, Nia Long and Nichelle Nichols

programme.title: TV3NewsUpdate
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's national and international headlines

programme.title: DancingonIce
programme.desc: Following the elimination of Bonnie Langford, the seven remaining stars bring out the leg warmers and colourful costumes in a celebration of all things 1984 as the show marks the 30th anniversary of Jayne Torvill and Christopher Dean winning gold at the Sarajevo Winter Olympics. The duo provide a special routine on the ice and the contestants all perform to songs from that year as they battle to win viewers' votes and praise from the judges. Phillip Schofield and Christine Bleakley present

programme.title: AllStarFamilyFortunes
programme.desc: Olympic rowing hero Steve Redgrave and Emmerdale's Natalie Anderson (Alicia Metcalfe) are joined by their families to answer a series of seemingly simple questions based on a survey of 100 members of the public. The winning team then goes on to the Big Money round, where a jackpot of £30,000 can be won for charity. Vernon Kay hosts the long-running game show

programme.title: DancingonIce:TheSkateOff
programme.desc: The two skaters who gained the least support from the public earlier tonight attempt to show they have what it takes to be the next - and last - Dancing on Ice champion, but the judges can save only one of them. Presented by Phillip Schofield and Christine Bleakley

programme.title: KeithBarry:BrainHacker
programme.desc: The showman and magician examines the subject of free will, exploring whether people's decisions are already pre-determined. The host tests his card skills in a Dublin casino, and is joined by mentalist Max Maven. Plus, Olympic archer Keith Hanlon fires an arrow through the head of an audience member

programme.title: A Gypsy Life for Me
programme.desc: The contest arrives at the prestigious Southbank Centre, where Miriam Czureja and her beatboxing sister hope to make it through the third heat

programme.title: The Girl with Seven Mums
programme.desc: Documentary following nine-year-old Ellie Sharp as she is raised by her Jewish father Philip and his seven wives - each of whom performs a different role in the home of Britain's only openly polygamous family. As cameras capture the emotional and practical difficulties created by such a complicated household structure, the programme also features Ellie's first steps into the outside world - when she visits a classroom for the very first time

Maire Treasa Ni Dhubhghaill presents coverage of the PRO12 match at Thomond Park, as the sides resume their league campaigns after a break for cup competitions. The Munstermen went into the break on top of the table and in a strong position to win the league, or at the very least qualify for the semi-finals. The Blues, by contrast, have struggled to find any consistency and will start as clear underdogs, especially on their travels. With commentary by Gearoid Mac Donncha

programme.title: Laochra Gael
programme.desc: Profiles of James McCartan and his son James Jr, who were at the heart of Down football during their most successful years in the 1960s and '90s. James Sr helped to win two All-Ireland Championships in 1960 and '61, transforming the fortunes of Down and Ulster football for ever. His son followed in his footsteps and won two All-Ireland medals in 1991 and '94. Featuring interviews with Maurice Hayes, Mick O'Dwyer, Ross Carr and Jarlath Burns
